channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OK
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OK

item.title: Report E-2024100396
item.description:
Report E-2024100396

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-18T06:17:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-16
  • City: GLENPOOL
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Approximately 1 cup of Ecolab Inspexx 250 released from a plastic tote due to a loose cap. The release impacted inside of trailer. No storm drains or soils were reported impacted.

item.title: Report E-2024100344
item.description:
Report E-2024100344

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-16T09:16:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-20
  • City: GLENPOOL
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1256ET, XPO-LTU notified ERTS of a cargo release. It was reported that approximately 1 quart of Armour last 1 released from metal pail due to improper packaging (no dunnage around the freight causing it to tip over in transit). The release impacted inside trailer#321-3352. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. 1 10-gallon metal drum contains product, pail and oil dri. The waste is staged for terminal personnel to manage.
